description: I created a landing page to practice my web development skills. This project required basic knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Through this project, I learned how to create columns, divide sections, arrange items, and add headers and footers. The most important aspect was unleashing my creativity to design an impressive page. I paid attention to alignments, padding, color palette, boxes, and other elements. I made sure to use CSS effectively to avoid overlapping elements. This landing page project allowed me to apply HTML and CSS skills while ensuring a visually appealing and user-friendly design.

I created a tribute page to honor someone I admire. With basic knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, I designed a webpage dedicated to this person. I wrote about their admirable qualities, added images, and created a visually appealing layout. I experimented with font styles, used paragraphs effectively, and played with background colors. This project allowed me to express my admiration in a simple and personalized way.

I created a personal portfolio to showcase my skills and projects. This project involved using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to create different sections such as a header, about me, skills, projects, resume, and contact information. I added my name and a logo at the top, a brief introduction, an image of myself, a short bio, key skills, samples of my work, and a downloadable resume. I included my contact information, such as my email address and phone number, and added a footer with a copyright notice and additional links.

For my final project, I replicated a law firm website based on a provided Figma design. This assignment allowed me to practice my web design skills by accurately translating a design into code. I paid attention to details and improved my CSS proficiency. I also used some basic JavaScript to enhance the functionality of the page.

I created a basic calculator using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. This project involved implementing an interactive interface with buttons for addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division operations. The calculator has a display screen to show user input and results. I used CSS grid system for button alignments and event listeners, if-else statements, operators, and loops to handle user input and perform calculations. This project required some skill but was manageable with basic knowledge of these technologies.

I developed an expense tracker application with a frontend and backend API. The frontend allows users to input and view their expenses, while the backend API handles data storage and retrieval. This project helped me practice full stack web development by integrating frontend and backend technologies.

I built an image gallery app using React and Tailwind CSS, integrating it with the Pixabay API. This project involved creating a responsive gallery where users can search for images. The app fetches data from the Pixabay API and displays the images in a grid format. This project helped me practice working with APIs and enhancing the user interface using Tailwind CSS.

I developed a React multi-step form with multiple components including user & personal details, confirmation, and success. I used Material UI to design the form, ensuring a clean and modern user interface. This project involved managing form state, handling user inputs, and transitioning between form steps. It helped me improve my skills in React and Material UI, as well as managing complex state in a multi-step form.

I built an image finder application using React and Material UI. This app uses the PixaBay API to fetch images based on a query string. Users can search for images, and the app displays the results in a grid format. Additionally, I implemented a Dialog box from Material UI to view the large image when clicked. This project helped me enhance my skills in working with APIs, managing state in React, and using Material UI components.

I created a Facebook login button in React to get the user's name, email, and picture. This project involved integrating the Facebook Login API to authenticate users and retrieve their profile information. I added the retrieved data to the component state and rendered it on the page. This project helped me understand how to work with third-party authentication APIs and manage user data in React.

I built a full stack file upload application using React and Express. The UI was constructed with Bootstrap elements, allowing users to select and upload files. The backend, built with Express, handles file storage and retrieval. This project helped me understand how to manage file uploads, work with HTTP requests, and integrate a React frontend with an Express backend.

I built an audiophile e-commerce app to improve my React knowledge and demonstrate expertise in building complex e-commerce applications. This project involved creating a user-friendly interface, managing state, and handling user authentication and payments. I used various media files, icons, and Figma designs to create a visually appealing and functional site. This project helped me enhance my skills in React, state management, and integrating third-party services for payments and user authentication.

I built a Todo List App where users can add tasks, check them as completed, delete tasks, and filter tasks by completed, active, or all items. This project involved creating a dynamic and interactive user interface, managing the state with React hooks, and ensuring a seamless user experience. It helped me enhance my skills in React, state management, and building CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) applications.

I created an Image Gallery with infinite scrolling using Node.js, React, and the Unsplash API. This project involved fetching images from the Unsplash API, implementing infinite scrolling to load more images as the user scrolls down, and managing the state to keep track of the images loaded. It helped me improve my skills in full stack web development, working with APIs, and implementing advanced UI features.

I developed a custom pagination feature in React to fetch and display a specific number of posts per page. This project leverages the power of React's useState and useEffect hooks for efficient state management and side effect handling. By implementing this feature, I aimed to enhance user experience by providing seamless navigation through paginated content. This project not only showcases my ability to work with APIs and manage state in a React application but also highlights my skills in creating dynamic and responsive user interfaces.

A simple and useful React.js dummy text generator application. This project allows users to generate placeholder text (Lorem Ipsum) for use in design mockups and other applications. The application features a user-friendly interface built with React.js and is easy to deploy on any server. It serves as a great tool for developers and designers needing quick access to dummy text while working on projects.

This project showcases the use of the ApexChart open-source library to create dynamic and interactive charts for data visualization. It includes two implementations: a vanilla JavaScript version and a Vite React version. By exploring both branches, you can see how to integrate ApexCharts into different environments to effectively display data.

In this project, I created an interactive, real-time animated clock using fundamental JavaScript concepts such as variables, functions, and objects. By manipulating the DOM with JavaScript, I animated the clock's hands and incorporated a ticking sound effect. This project is a practical application of JavaScript's Date object, setInterval method, and CSS transformations.

I built a countdown app to showcase my understanding of JavaScript basics such as variables, functions, and objects. This project involved manipulating the DOM to create interactive web pages with multiple countdown timers. The timers are fully functional and update in real-time.

I created a tapas app to showcase my understanding of JavaScript basics such as variables, functions, and objects. This project involved manipulating the DOM to create an interactive web page with a list of tapas and a form to add new tapas. The data is stored in localStorage, ensuring it persists even after the browser is closed.

I built a GitHub User Profile Viewer to showcase my skills in working with APIs, handling asynchronous JavaScript, and dynamically updating the DOM. This project uses the GitHub Users API to pull profile data based on user input and display it on the webpage.

I built a Country Data Explorer to showcase my skills in working with APIs, managing user input, and creating responsive UIs. This project uses the REST Countries API to pull and display country data, including features like search, filter, and detailed views for each country.

I developed a backend API for the DevCamper application, which is a bootcamp directory website. This project demonstrates my skills in building RESTful APIs, managing complex database relationships, and implementing robust CRUD operations.

I developed a web application where I can add and create a menu list for pizzas. The app features a form that allows me to input the title, description, toppings, and price for each pizza. This project demonstrates my skills in handling form submissions, managing state, and dynamically rendering content.

I created a portfolio website using React to showcase my projects, skills, and experience. This site includes an interactive and responsive design, project gallery, contact form, and a blog section. The goal was to build a professional and aesthetically pleasing online presence.

A TypeScript-based drag-and-drop project management application. Users can create projects with a title, description, and number of people, and organize them into 'Active' or 'Finished' lists. Features include dynamic form validation, draggable list items, and modular code using namespaces and decorators.

I developed a comprehensive mini fintech application that leverages Firebase for backend services and Paystack for secure payment processing. This application supports a range of essential financial features including user sign-up and login, adding money to the user's account, sending money to other users, and viewing detailed transaction history. The user authentication and real-time database capabilities of Firebase ensure a seamless and secure user experience. Paystack integration allows for robust and reliable payment processing, adhering to high-security standards. This project demonstrates my ability to create full-stack applications that are both functional and secure, offering users a smooth and efficient way to manage their finances.

project_name: Sharing a Place via Google Maps
description: I developed a web application that allows users to search for an address and view its corresponding location on a Google Map. This project leverages the power of TypeScript for type-safe coding, Axios for making HTTP requests, and the Google Maps API for map rendering. Users can input an address, and the application fetches the location data from the Google Geocoding API, displaying it on an interactive Google Map. This project showcases my ability to integrate third-party APIs and handle asynchronous operations efficiently. It also demonstrates my skills in frontend development, ensuring a user-friendly interface for a seamless experience.

This is a Post Management Application built using React, Axios, and React Router. The application allows users to create, view, and interact with posts. It features a responsive design, modal-based post creation, and integration with a backend server. The project showcases my ability to build a user-friendly interface with modern web technologies.

MeetUp Manager is a full-stack application built with React and Firebase. It allows users to view, add, and manage meetups. The application includes features for adding new meetups, marking favorites, and fetching data from Firebase. It showcases a responsive design with a modern user interface using CSS.

Meals Explorer is a Next.js application for discovering, sharing, and exploring meal recipes. Users can browse through a collection of meals, view detailed recipes, and submit their favorite dishes. The application features a responsive design, integrates with AWS S3 for image storage, and uses a SQLite database for managing meal data. It offers a modern user interface styled with CSS.

Next News Archive is a modern Next.js application designed to deliver the latest news and provide access to archived articles. The application supports dynamic routing, server-side rendering, and features a modular design for easy scalability. It includes a marketing section, a dedicated news archive, and supports custom error pages. The project utilizes a dummy dataset for news articles and images, and offers a responsive and clean user interface.

Feed Post is a dynamic and interactive Next.js application designed for sharing and browsing posts. The application supports server-side rendering, image uploads via Cloudinary, and features a modular design with reusable components. Users can create posts, like them, and view a feed of all posts. The project includes error handling, loading states, and leverages SQLite for database interactions.

Messaging and Chat Upload is an advanced Next.js application designed for seamless communication. The app features real-time messaging, chat uploads, and dynamic content rendering. It uses SQLite for data storage, Express.js for the backend, and supports server-side rendering. The project is modular, with reusable components, and includes caching strategies for optimal performance.

The Training Exercise App is an online platform designed to provide users with access to a wide range of training exercises. The app features a secure authentication system, a comprehensive catalog of training modules, and user profile management. It utilizes SQLite for data storage and offers a responsive, user-friendly interface.

The Events Handler App is a dynamic event listing platform built with Next.js 14. It features a fully responsive design, server-side rendering, and static site generation. Users can browse, search, and filter events. The app includes modular components for event details, error alerts, and UI elements, all while utilizing CSS Modules for scoped styling.

The Next Full Blog Posts project is a comprehensive blogging platform built with Next.js 14. It features dynamic routing, server-side rendering, and static site generation for optimal performance. Users can read, create, and contact the author through a responsive and user-friendly interface. The app leverages Markdown for content management and includes modular components for blog posts, contact forms, and UI notifications, all styled using CSS Modules.
